DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test effectiveness prescribe park use ( i.e. , `` Park Prescription '' ) insufficiently active individual . It hypothesize Park Prescription motivate target population increase physical activity thereby improve physical mental health .
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : There substantial international research finding support role natural environment play enhance human health prevention chronic disease . Also , evidence highlighting ( cost- ) effectiveness prescribe physical activity promote one 's physical activity health . However , lack methodologically rigorous study look effectiveness combine two promising approach ; i.e. , physical activity prescription focus use park green space : Park Prescription . AIMS : This Randomized Controlled Trial ( RCT ) investigate concept Park Prescription health promote intervention individual . The primary objective investigate effectiveness park prescription intervention increase participant 's time spend moderate vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) . Main secondary objective assess ; A ) improvement physical health ( e.g. , blood sugar blood pressure ) health behaviour ( e.g. , sit time ) ; B ) improvement mental health ( e.g. , quality life ) ; 3 ) intervention implementation fidelity association park use perceive study participant satisfaction . METHODOLOGY : Participants age 40 65 year recruit Singapore Population Health Community Screening Programme conduct Alexandra Health Pte Ltd . They randomly assign one follow two arm ; 1 ) park prescription + participation weekly structure physical activity program conduct park , 2 ) control group . Participants enrol study period 6 month . They complete baseline assessment , 3-month 6-month follow-up . The investigator aim recruit 80 participant arm , make total 160 study participant .
DOC.criteria: Subjects must meet inclusion criterion list participate study . Study participant must : 1. currently sufficiently active ( less 150 minute per week exercise ) ; 2. complete pas PARQ+* ; 3. blood pressure less equal ( < = ) 139 mmHG ( systolic ) less equal ( < = ) 89 mmHG ( diastolic ) ; 4. fast glucose level less equal ( < = ) 6.0 mmol/l ) ; 5. Singaporean Permanent Residents ; 6. able write read ; 7. provide inform consent . All subject meet follow exclusion criterion exclude participation : 1. pregnant woman ; 2. people severe medical condition prohibit participation physical activity assess PARQ ( include , heart disease , lung disease , diabetes ) ; 3. people blood pressure > 139 mmHG ( systolic ) > 89 mmHG ( diastolic ) ; 4. people fast glucose level > 6.0 mmol/l ) ; 5. physical disability low limb disorder . The Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire ( PARQ ) selfguided , nine question screen tool quickly identify condition risk factor require assessment engage physical activity . See : British Columbia Ministry Health Department National Health Welfare : Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire . Canada : 1992.For current study , use amend version PARQ . The PARQ+ also include additional section formally assess subject ' age , whether physical disability low limb disorder , physical activity status .
